etymologies: Old English wealcan ‘roll, toss’, also ‘wander’, of Germanic origin. The sense ‘move about’, and specifically ‘go about on foot’, arose in Middle English

definitions: move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once

examples.text: I walked across the lawn
she turned and walked a few paces

shortDefinitions: move at regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

definitions: go on foot for recreation and exercise

examples.text: you can walk in 21,000 acres of mountain and moorland

shortDefinitions: go on foot for recreation and exercise

definitions: travel along or over (a route or area) on foot

examples.text: the police department has encouraged officers to walk the beat

shortDefinitions: travel over route or area on foot

definitions: use movements similar to walking but with a different part of one's body or a support

examples.text: he could walk on his hands carrying a plate on one foot

shortDefinitions: move in similar way to walking, but using one's hands or support such as stilts

definitions: (of a quadruped) proceed with the slowest gait, always having at least two feet on the ground at once.
shortDefinitions: (of quadruped) proceed with slowest gait, always having at least two feet on ground at once

definitions: ride (a horse) at its slowest gait

examples.text: he walked his horse toward her

shortDefinitions: ride horse at slowest pace

definitions: guide, accompany, or escort (someone) on foot

examples.text: he walked her home to her door

shortDefinitions: guide, accompany, or escort someone on foot

definitions: take (a domestic animal, typically a dog) out for exercise

examples.text: a man walking his retriever

shortDefinitions: take dog out for exercise

definitions: abandon or suddenly withdraw from a job, commitment, or situation

examples.text: he was in place as the male lead but walked at the eleventh hour
we were expecting the merger with Bell to go through—we didn't expect Bell to walk on the deal

shortDefinitions: abandon or suddenly withdraw from job or commitment

definitions: be released from suspicion or from a charge

examples.text: had any of the others come clean during the trial, he might have walked

shortDefinitions: be released from suspicion or from charge

definitions: be awarded first base after not swinging at four balls pitched outside the strike zone.
shortDefinitions: reach first base automatically after not hitting at four balls pitched outside strike zone

definitions: allow or enable (a batter) to walk.
shortDefinitions: allow or enable batter to do this

definitions: (of a pitcher) give a walk with the bases loaded so as to force in (a run).
shortDefinitions: (of pitcher) give walk with bases loaded so as to force in

crossReferenceMarkers: another term for travel (sense 3 of the verb)

definitions: (of a ghost) be present and visible

examples.text: the ghosts of Bannockburn walked abroad

shortDefinitions: be visible

definitions: used to describe the way in which someone lives or behaves

examples.text: walk humbly with your God

shortDefinitions: live or behave in particular way

definitions: an act of traveling or an excursion on foot

examples.text: he was too restless to sleep, so he went out for a walk

shortDefinitions: act of travelling or outing on foot

definitions: used to indicate the time that it will take someone to reach a place on foot or the distance that they must travel

examples.text: the library is within five minutes' walk

shortDefinitions: used to indicate time that it will take to reach place on foot or distance to be travelled

definitions: a route recommended or marked out for recreational walking

examples.text: there are picnic places and waymarked walks

shortDefinitions: route recommended or marked out for recreational walking

definitions: a sidewalk or path

examples.text: the street lamps illuminated the riverside walk

shortDefinitions: path

definitions: the round followed by a mail carrier

examples.text: the first job is to sort the mail into routes or walks

shortDefinitions: round followed by postman

definitions: an unhurried rate of movement on foot

examples.text: they crossed the field at a leisurely walk

shortDefinitions: unhurried rate of movement on foot

definitions: the slowest gait of an animal

examples.text: she reined her horse to a slow walk

shortDefinitions: slowest gait of animal

definitions: a person's manner of walking

examples.text: the spring was back in his walk

shortDefinitions: person's manner of walking

definitions: a part of a forest under one keeper.
shortDefinitions: part of forest under one keeper

definitions: an instance of being awarded (or allowing a batter to reach) first base after not swinging at four balls pitched outside the strike zone.
shortDefinitions: instance of reaching first base automatically after not hitting at four balls pitched outside strike zone
